title: Add a bigger penalty for dodging in PBE
body: 11 games im trying to play, and everyone is dodging with no big consequences, it makes trying to find bugs by actually being able to play the game impossible.

replies.body:
The problem is that on both live and PBE the time before your dodge penalty resets is a fucking joke. Not even 24 hours.

Riot needs to start requiring you to **complete** games in the relevant queue to reduce the penalty. Even a 3 game requirement would fix the problem.

However, you just have to wait until tomorrow and, boom. Penalty's completely reset to base value.

You can't have both a pathetically easy to reduce penalty alongside a pathetically small initial penalty. One or the other, but not both.

I agree. Queue dodge penalties should stack upon each other forever until they actually play games to reduce the stacks.
I've been through 20 queue dodges now and one of them are mine because my team was {{champion:350}} top lane and {{champion:157}} support. I just wanna play the game. I have no interest in playing the character.
Lol that dosent even sound like an off meta comp, just a role trade.
it'll certainly shut up the players who say dodging is a viable strategy because they judge players off their rank and other stuff.

Ally: *Has a 49.9% winrate*

Those dumbasses: "TIME TO FUKIN DODGE THIS TRASH BROKEN BIASED MATCHMAKING WTF RITO WHY WOULD YOU GIVE ME A MATCH LIKE THIS YOU FUCKING HATE ME AND WANT TO KILL  MY FAMILY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!11"

Well, you just detected a flaw in their system. Looks like PBE works as intended :D

(But they wont change it, so maybe it does not work like intended O.o )

And what of the times where you lock in support, and then realize you were assigned JG? Actually playing JG with a totally bad character+build is an offense, que dodging, not so much. I'll que dodge when I realize I made a significant mistake after accepting the que timer- which ranges from the above, to boss calling in asking me to come in to work.
